TEXT: The applicant is a NORP citizen , born in DATE and living in GPE , GPE .
This is the applicant 's second application . The previous one ( number CARDINAL ) was declared inadmissible by the ORG in DATE .

On DATE , the applicant was charged with aggravated assault before ORG ( PERSON ) . On DATE , ORG stayed the proceedings against the applicant due to the expiry of the time - limit for prosecution and stated that the ORG would issue a separate decision on the costs of the proceedings .

On DATE , the ORG dismissed the applicant 's request for reimbursement of the costs of the proceedings , as the applicant did not submit relevant evidence in support of his claim . ORG instructed the applicant that he could lodge an appeal against that decision with ORG PERSON u GPE ) .

On DATE , ORG , upon the applicant 's appeal , remitted the case to ORG stating that ORG had both the trial and appellate jurisdiction on that issue . ORG instructed ORG to deliver a decision upon the applicant 's appeal .

On DATE ORG again dismissed the applicant 's request for the costs of the proceedings , again stating that the applicant did not submit the relevant evidence . Again , ORG instructed the applicant that he could lodge an appeal with ORG .

On DATE , ORG dismissed the applicant 's appeal as inadmissible . The ORG stated that ORG wrongly instructed the applicant that the appeal was to be lodged with ORG as the appellate court , while ORG for the applicant 's case was both the first instance and the appellate court . However , ORG held that , although ORG had not mentioned the applicant 's appeal in its decision , it was evident that ORG actually ruled on the applicant 's appeal , because the first decision by ORG had been delivered by a single judge , while the second decision of ORG was delivered by a special panel of CARDINAL judges . According to LAW that panel was to act as an appellate body within ORG for certain type of decisions of those courts . Furthermore , ORG held that there was no right to appeal against ORG CARDINAL - member panel decision on the costs of criminal proceedings .

On DATE , the applicant lodged a constitutional complaint with ORG ( Ustavni sud PERSON ) , claiming , in substance , that his rights to fair trial and to an effective remedy have been violated . The complaint is still pending .
